name: imcyto-imaging-mass-cytometry
title: IMCyto: Image Mass Cytometry Analysis Pipeline
description: Comprehensive imaging mass cytometry (IMC) pipeline for image segmentation and single-cell expression data extraction. Processes high-dimensional imaging data through CellProfiler and optional Ilastik pixel classification to generate single-cell expression profiles from tissue samples.
content:
üî¨ IMCyto: Image Mass Cytometry Analysis

Extract Single-Cell Expression Data from High-Dimensional Tissue Images

Imaging Mass Cytometry (IMC) enables simultaneous measurement of 40+ protein markers at single-cell resolution in tissue sections. This pipeline automates the complete workflow from raw IMC data to single-cell expression matrices, combining powerful image processing tools for accurate cell segmentation and quantification.

üéØ Pipeline Workflow

The pipeline performs stepwise analysis of IMC data through several key stages:

1. Image File Processing

  • üìÅ Format Conversion: Converts MCD files to individual channel TIFFs using imctools

  • üîß Image Splitting: Separates multi-channel data into individual metal/marker channels

  • üé® Stack Generation: Creates composite images for visualization and analysis

2. Image Preprocessing (CellProfiler)

  • üåü Full Stack: Preprocesses all marker channels for comprehensive analysis

  • üéØ Ilastik Stack: Prepares specific channels for pixel classification (membrane, nuclear, cytoplasmic markers)

  • üîç Quality Enhancement: Applies filters to improve signal-to-noise ratio

3. Pixel Classification (Optional Ilastik)

  • üß† Machine Learning: Trains or applies supervised pixel classification models

  • üìä Probability Maps: Generates probability images for cellular compartments (membrane, nucleus, background)

  • ‚ö° Bypass Option: Use --skip_ilastik for CellProfiler-only workflows

4. Cell Segmentation (CellProfiler)

  • üîµ Nuclear Detection: Identifies nuclei as primary objects using nuclear markers

  • ‚≠ï Cell Boundary Detection: Defines whole cells as secondary objects using membrane probability maps

  • üé≠ Mask Generation: Creates single-cell segmentation masks for expression extraction

5. Single-Cell Data Extraction

  • üìà Expression Quantification: Measures mean marker intensity per cell across all channels

  • üìã Metadata Integration: Combines expression data with cell morphology and spatial coordinates

  • üíæ Matrix Export: Generates analysis-ready CSV files with single-cell expression profiles

üìã Input Requirements

Required Files

  • üî¨ IMC Data Files: Raw imaging data in supported formats:

    • *.mcd - Fluidigm MCD format (most common)

    • *.ome.tiff - OME-TIFF format

    • *.txt - Text-based formats

  • üìä Metadata CSV: Channel selection file with 3 columns:

    • metal - Metal isotope/marker name

    • full_stack - Include in full analysis (1) or exclude (0)

    • ilastik_stack - Include in Ilastik classification (1) or exclude (0)

CellProfiler Pipeline Files (*.cppipe)

  • üîß Full Stack Preprocessing: Pipeline for processing all marker channels

  • üéØ Ilastik Stack Preprocessing: Pipeline for preparing Ilastik input channels

  • ‚úÇÔ∏è Segmentation Pipeline: Pipeline for cell segmentation using probability maps

Ilastik Configuration (Optional)

  • üß† Training Parameter File: Pre-trained Ilastik model (*.ilp format)

  • Contains pixel classification model for membrane/nucleus/background detection

  • Can be skipped with --skip_ilastik flag for CellProfiler-only workflows

CellProfiler Plugins (Optional)

  • üîå Custom Plugins: Directory containing Python plugin files for CellProfiler

  • Required if custom CellProfiler modules are used in pipeline files

‚öôÔ∏è Configuration Options

Processing Modes

  • üî¨ Standard Mode: Full workflow with Ilastik pixel classification (default)

    • Best for: Complex tissue architectures, overlapping cells, high-quality segmentation

    • Requires: All input files including Ilastik training parameters

  • ‚ö° CellProfiler-Only Mode: Bypass Ilastik using --skip_ilastik

    • Best for: Simple tissue structures, well-defined cell boundaries, faster processing

    • Requires: Ilastik training parameter file can be omitted

Metadata Configuration

The metadata CSV controls which markers are used in each analysis stage:

metal,full_stack,ilastik_stack
DNA1,1,1
Histone,1,1
CD45,1,0
CD3,1,0
CD20,1,0
PanCK,1,1

  • full_stack=1: Include marker in final expression matrix and visualization

  • ilastik_stack=1: Use marker for pixel classification (typically structural markers)

  • Strategy: Use structural markers (DNA, membrane, cytoplasm) for Ilastik, all markers for full stack

üìä Output Files

Single-Cell Expression Data

  • üìà Expression Matrix (CSV): Cell √ó marker expression values

    • Mean intensity per cell for all markers

    • Cell morphology features (area, perimeter, shape descriptors)

    • Spatial coordinates (X, Y positions in tissue)

Segmentation Results

  • üé≠ Cell Masks (TIFF): Single-cell segmentation masks

    • Each cell assigned unique integer ID

    • Directly overlays original images

    • Compatible with visualization tools (QuPath, ImageJ, napari)

Processed Images

  • üìÅ Full Stack TIFFs: Preprocessed marker images ready for downstream analysis

  • üé® Ilastik Probability Maps: Pixel classification probability images

    • Probabilities_0: Membrane probability

    • Probabilities_1: Nucleus probability (if applicable)

    • Probabilities_2: Background probability

Quality Control

  • üìä MultiQC Report: Comprehensive quality metrics and processing statistics

  • üîç CellProfiler Logs: Detailed processing information and warnings

  • üìà Summary Statistics: Cell counts, marker distributions, segmentation quality metrics

üß™ Use Cases

  • üéóÔ∏è Cancer Research: Tumor microenvironment characterization, immune cell infiltration analysis

  • üî¨ Immunology: Immune cell phenotyping, spatial organization of immune populations

  • üß¨ Developmental Biology: Tissue organization during development, lineage tracing

  • üè• Clinical Pathology: Biomarker discovery, patient stratification, diagnostic applications

  • üß† Neuroscience: Brain tissue analysis, neuronal population characterization

  • ü¶† Infectious Disease: Host-pathogen interactions in tissue context

‚ö†Ô∏è Important Notes

  • üîß Nextflow Version: This pipeline uses DSL1 and requires Nextflow version ‚â§22.10.6

  • üíª Computational Resources: IMC analysis is memory-intensive; recommend large system size for full datasets

  • üì¶ Container Support: Fully containerized with Docker and Singularity for reproducibility

  • üéì CellProfiler Knowledge: Familiarity with CellProfiler pipelines helpful for customization

üöÄ Downstream Analysis

Pipeline outputs are compatible with:

  • üêç Python: scanpy, anndata, squidpy for spatial analysis

  • üìä R: Seurat, SingleCellExperiment, imcRtools for single-cell analysis

  • üñºÔ∏è Visualization: QuPath, ImageJ/Fiji, napari for spatial visualization

  • üìà Statistical Analysis: Standard tools for differential expression, clustering, spatial statistics

Perfect for: Spatial biology ‚Ä¢ Tissue imaging ‚Ä¢ Single-cell proteomics ‚Ä¢ Tumor microenvironment ‚Ä¢ Biomarker discovery ‚Ä¢ Clinical research ‚Ä¢ Immunology ‚Ä¢ Cancer biology
